$MNDT so many people on this page shouldn’t be in individual stocks. You don’t take a company private that’s trading at $15 at $35 just because it used to have a higher multiple. This stock was around $15 and traded up to $18-$19 on the rumor. You got a 55% premium. That’s comparable to what $MSFT paid for $ATVI and $CRM paid for $WORK . Notice no one in the press is calling this a bad deal and it’s actually given other cyber names some buzz. Yes, this perhaps had more potential as a public company, but you were never going to get a $35 or $100 take private. Don’t tell me that it WAS trading higher a few months ago either- that doesn’t matter, it’s being acquired today, not yesterday.

$SPY $QQQ $AAPL $MSFT $SOFI 1 of the most real posts I’ve read on here.

$SPY $QQQ $AAPL $MSFT $DOGE.X 

Wallstbets did more damage to inexperienced investors than anything I have ever seen.

They could have used their platform and following to actually educate investors, and teach them financial tools that they may not get elsewhere. 

Instead they yolo’d money into shitty stocks at ATH’s and watched that $ drain while screaming “to the moon” 

Knowing that hedge funds move markets, did they really expect the purchasing power of a few reddit users to outweigh hundreds of hedge funds pockets? It’s not possible. They knew this.

There is absolutely no way a group of users came together to pump up a stock for a company that’s been screwing people over on their trade ins, with a dying business model & drying up balance sheet. 

Something tells me a hedge fund was behind that forum and movement as a whole, by teaching people to yolo money and buy bad stocks they’ve created a whole new generation of inexperienced investors to profit on for life.
